951a749d8ecd.title: JS “Standard” style is a “so called standard” that has been called out for it’s potentially…

paragraphs.text: JS “Standard” style is a “so called standard” that has been called out for it’s potentially breaking style suggestions by several people. Please don’t do any more marketing. There’s no “Standard”. There are many standards. Most popular of which is JS airbnb style guide

paragraphs.text: While E. Northcote Parkinson did indeed coin this term with his bicycle shed example, the article in which he did so was one of a series of satirical pseudo-academic pieces written (if my memory serves) for The Economist magazine. It was not a real academic study.

paragraphs.text: If we are writing JavaScript, we must understand how ASI, and the many other “footguns” of the language work. No style guide or convention can absolve us of this.

paragraphs.text: For an interesting point-of-view on ASI, have a look at…

by Isaac Z. Schlueter (one of the founders of NPM)

c7c4da671652.title: You had my interest until you recommended I read anything Schlueter has ever written.

paragraphs.text: You had my interest until you recommended I read anything Schlueter has ever written. Beyond the “esthetics” (his word) NPM is perhaps the worst, large-scale, accidentally adopted technology failure since VHS prompting fix attempt after fix attempt for it but ultimately reminding me (and countless others including the creator of Express) to leave JavaScript in the dust for this sort of thing. ;)
paragraphs.name: 484b

d1aa456c0ffb.title: What is important is not the convention itself, it’s the fact that a team agree on using a given…

paragraphs.text: What is important is not the convention itself, it’s the fact that a team agree on using a given one, set a git hook forcing to comply… and more importantly stop debating/trolling about it.

d8627d568e1a.title: The most important standard isn’t style; it’s consistency.

paragraphs.text: The most important standard isn’t style; it’s consistency. Whatever style standard you choose for a codebase, it’s important that new additions are consistent with that style. What drives me up the wall isn’t a coding style that is different from my own, but rather a codebase which adhered to absolutely no specific style throughout, even within the…
paragraphs.name: 6d19

virtuals.subtitle: Look, if you’re going to use tabs, be consistent, and use tabs everywhere. If you’re going to use spaces, use them everywhere. The same…

content.subtitle: Look, if you’re going to use tabs, be consistent, and use tabs everywhere. If you’re going to use spaces, use them everywhere. The same…

d8c1ce8b3958.title: I would caution your readers that sometimes style differences are actually syntax differences and…

paragraphs.text: I would caution your readers that sometimes style differences are actually syntax differences and to be sure to rule that out before calling it “silly.” For example, your if image encourages the notion that starting a block on a separate line is just a matter of style, (which it is for C), but it is not for JavaScript, (which I imagine is the primary…
